Location scouting: Identifying suitable locations that can be transformed into sets, while also ensuring they are available and affordable.
Budget management: Balancing the costs of production, including actors, crew, props, and special effects, while maintaining a profit margin.
Screenplay development: Ensuring the script is coherent, well-written, and adheres to the director's vision.
Crew management: Hiring and managing a large team of technicians, artists, and other professionals, as well as coordinating their work.
Special effects and visual effects: Ensuring the film's visual elements are realistic and seamless, while also managing the technical aspects of their production.
